articles.author: Hannah Confino
articles.description: The Israeli ambassador to the United States was quoted saying a deal could transpire within days.
articles.title: Israel moving towards Hezbollah ceasefire but issues remain, spokesperson says

articles.author: Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hong Kong's top court on Tuesday upheld three earlier rulings that favoured granting public housing and inheritance rights to married same-sex couples, citing equality provisions in the city's mini-constitution, known as the Basic Law.
articles.title: Top Hong Kong court dismisses government appeal in gay rights housing case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesian rescuers are searching for 7 people still missing four days after torrential rain hit North Sumatra province, causing flash flooding and landslides which killed 15 people, an official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Indonesia province resumes search for 7 missing after landslide and floods kill 15

articles.author: Lidia Kelly, Oleksandr Kozhukhar
articles.description: Russian forces have been advancing in Ukraine at the fastest pace since the early months of the war, are moving into the strategic town of Kurakhove and have been exploiting vulnerabilities of Kyiv troops, analysts said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia advances in Ukraine at fast pace, moving into Kurakhove, analysts say

articles.author: Kantaro Komiya
articles.description: Japan's space agency has halted an engine combustion test of its Epsilon S rocket, a spokesperson said on Tuesday, after a fire broke out at the test site, 16 months after another failed engine test derailed Japan's small rocket development.
articles.title: Japan's space agency halts Epsilon S rocket engine test after fire

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: A U.S. judge on Monday dismissed the federal criminal case accusing Donald Trump of attempting to overturn his 2020 election defeat after prosecutors moved to drop that prosecution and a second case against the president-elect, citing Justice Department policy against prosecuting a sitting president.
articles.title: Judge tosses Trump 2020 election case after prosecutors' request

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sergei Shoigu, the secretary of Russia's powerful Security Council, told Afghanistan's Taliban leaders on Monday that Moscow wanted to help achieve a durable peace in the country, Russian news agencies reported.
articles.title: Russia pledges broader Afghanistan ties, says US should help rebuild

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Ecuadorean court on Monday convicted 20 of 21 total defendants in a wide-ranging organized crime and drug trafficking case involving the Andean country's judicial system, sentencing them to between 40 months and 10 years in prison.
articles.title: Ecuador judge convicts 20 in judiciary corruption case

articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: A DHL cargo plane crashed near Lithuania’s Vilnius airport on Monday at about 0330 GMT, killing one person and injuring two others, airport, police and firefighter officials told Reuters.
articles.title: One dead, two injured in DHL cargo plane crash near Vilnius airport

articles.author: Luiza Ilie, Mara Vilcu
articles.description: A hard-right critic of NATO who has praised Russia is set to face a centre-right opposition leader in a presidential election run-off in Romania that could undermine its pro-Western stance after a shock outcome in the first-round vote.
articles.title: In election shock, Romanian far-right NATO critic set for presidential contest
